tools.name: MACS2
tools.function:
snATAC-seq Peak Calling

Identify regions of open chromatin from snATAC-seq data by calling peaks using MACS2 (Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq). The input is aligned reads, and the output consists of genomic coordinates for called peaks that represent accessible chromatin regions.

tools.name: Signac
tools.function:
snATAC-seq Quality Control, Filtering, Normalization, and Dimensionality Reduction

Apply quality control metrics to snATAC-seq data to filter out low-quality cells, then normalize data and reduce dimensionality. The input is the raw snATAC-seq data, and the output will be a filtered, normalized, and dimensionally-reduced dataset.

tools.name: Seurat
tools.function:
scRNA-seq Data Preprocessing and Analysis

Perform data normalization, dimensionality reduction, clustering, and differential expression analysis. The inputs are raw scRNA-seq gene expression data, and the outputs are processed data and analysis results.

tools.name: pySCENIC
tools.function:
Gene Regulatory Network (GRN) Analysis

Infers gene regulatory networks (GRNs) to identify TF-target gene interactions and determine the regulons active in each cell type. The pySCENIC pipeline is used for the various steps.

tools.name: ChIPseeker
tools.function:
snATAC-seq peak annotation

Annotate identified peaks with genomic features - e.g. promoters, or enhancers.

tools.name: scRNA-seq data analysis
tools.function:
Cell Type Annotation

Label cells in snRNA-seq experiments with reference to known markers from curated literature or databases.

tools.name: Monocle2
tools.function:
Pseudotime Trajectory Analysis

Perform pseudotime trajectory analysis to study cell developmental trajectories and identify DEGs. It applies dimensionality reduction as well as cell ordering to generate trajectories. Visualization is used as well.
